alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Otsego and northeastern Delaware Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elk Creek, or 9 miles southeast of Cooperstown, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rain and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy wind leading to poor visibility on I-88. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Maryland, Westville, Westford, Milford, Schenevus, Elk Creek, Fergusonville and Betty And Wilbur Davis State Park. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 88 between 18 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water and near zero visibility along I-88 and other highways.
